title: Pharmaceutical companies use Trump to put pressure on Europe
summary: Amid the threat from the American president to impose tariffs on healthcare drugs, pharmaceutical companies are advocating for a price increase, claiming that treatments are not compensated fairly on the European continent.

title: Israeli-American hostage Edan Alexander freed by Hamas, on Israeli territory
summary: Edan Alexander was kidnapped and held in Gaza since October 7, 2023.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs was 'coercive and criminal,' jury hears as sex trafficking trial begins
summary: Twelve jurors will judge Combs' case, who is charged with sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy.

title: US announces new sanctions against Iran as talks proceed
summary: The United States announced the new sanctions a day after a fourth round of talks with Iran concluded. No major breakthrough was announced after the talks, but both sides voiced cautious optimism.

title: Germans' opinion of Israel has deteriorated
summary: A study by the Bertelsmann Foundation, published on Friday, confirms a trend that predates October 7. Only 36% of respondents today express a positive opinion of Israel, which is 10 points less than in 2021.

title: Amid the Siberian winter, strange snow mounds have emerged after the accelerated thawing of permafrost
summary: These mounds are not new, but they are multiplying due to climate change and are spreading into cities, threatening some infrastructure.

title: Trump defends resettling white South Africans as refugees in US
summary: A group of around 50 Afrikaners arrived at an airport outside Washington on Monday after Trump granted them refugee status.

title: Governor Gavin Newsom urges California cities to clear homeless encampments: 'No more excuses'
summary: On Monday, Governor Newsom unveiled a plan to address the makeshift tents that line streets and parks up and down the state. California alone has more than 187,000 people in need of housing − a quarter of the US homeless population.

title: Cannes makes it official: No nudity on the red carpet
summary: The much-awaited French film festival also said outfits that 'hindered the flow of traffic' would not be permitted on the red carpet this year, either.

title: Leading Hollywood actors and directors denounce the 'genocide' in Gaza: 'We cannot remain silent'
summary: In an open letter released on the eve of the Cannes Film Festival, actors and directors including Richard Gere, Susan Sarandon and Pedro Almodovar urged the film community to 'rise up' and 'name reality.'

title: The Elysée debunks rumor that President Macron hid cocaine
summary: Pro-Russian X accounts have attempted to use blurry photos to portray a used tissue as a bag of the drug. This slanderous rumor has been a recurring accusation against the French leader since he was first elected in 2017.

title: Diplomatic duel between Zelensky and Putin under pressure from Trump
summary: The Russian president rejected the ceasefire offer on Monday and proposed direct negotiations in Istanbul. His Ukrainian counterpart seized the opportunity to suggest a 'personal' meeting.

title: Trump administration revokes temporary protections for Afghans, citing an improved security situation
summary: Secretary of Homeland Security Kristi Noem said that the temporary protected status (TPS) designation for Afghanistan would expire on May 20, in a move that critics have said 'is not rooted in reality [but] in politics.' Some 11,000 Afghans are currently covered by TPS in the United States.

title: The golden jackal, a newcomer to France that could become a permanent resident
summary: This species, sporadically spotted in France since 2017, has recently been seen in the southwest and Normandy. Since the 1960s, the population established notably in the Balkans has been spreading across Western Europe.

title: Poland orders closure of Russian consulate in Krakow over 'sabotage'
summary: Since Russia's February 2022 invasion of Ukraine, Kyiv's ally Poland has claimed to be the target of sabotage attempts blamed on Russia.

title: Belarus potato shortage sparks discontent
summary: According to experts, the scarcity of this vegetable, a symbol of national identity, is linked to state-set prices, which make it unprofitable to sell on the domestic market and encourage producers to export their produce to Russia.

title: US and China agree to slash tariffs for 90 days
summary: The US treasury secretary said the two sides both agreed to reduce tariffs by 115 percentage points, taking US tariffs to 30% and those by China to 10%. In a joint statement, the two sides agreed to 'establish a mechanism to continue discussions about economic and trade relations.'

title: After the ceasefire, lessons from the worst India-Pakistan clash in 20 years
summary: At the urging of the Americans, the two belligerents agreed to cease hostilities on Saturday, May 10. However, gunfire and explosions continued along the borderline in Kashmir.

title: Italy turns its back on its pioneers' legacy in founding the EU
summary: Italy, a key player in the creation of the European Union, born from the rejection of nationalism after World War II, has gradually turned away from federalism. Today, the shift has led the Meloni government to deny the legacy of Spinelli and De Gasperi, Italian fathers of modern Europe.

title: More than 83 million internally displaced people were registered in 2024 − a new record
summary: Raging conflicts, disasters and climate change are responsible for the displacement of tens of millions of people, with Gaza and Sudan hit the hardest. The lack of progress toward reining in global displacement marks 'a policy failure and a moral stain on humanity.'

title: US State Department has authorized the sale of $1.4 billion worth of weapons to the United Arab Emirates
summary: The proposed sale involves military aircraft and equipment that would 'support the foreign policy and national security of the United States': 'The [UAE] is a vital US partner for political stability and economic progress in the Middle East.'

title: UN aviation agency finds Russia responsible for 2014 downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 over Ukraine
summary: On July 17, 2014 the Malaysia Airlines Boeing 777 – en route from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur – was hit by a Russian-made BUK surface-to-air missile over eastern Ukraine's Donetsk region, where pro-Russian separatist rebels were battling Ukrainian forces. 298 people died in the tragedy.

title: The Trump family's lucrative business deals in the Gulf
summary: As the US president prepares for an official visit to Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the United Arab Emirates from May 13 to 16, his sons continue to expand the family business, showing little regard for potential conflicts of interest.

title: Germany bans largest 'Citizens of the Reich' group and arrests four leaders
summary: The German government banned the extremist counter-state organization, conducted raids on dozens of its properties and members' homes and seized its assets.

title: How a crucial part of André Breton's studio moved from Paris to Metz
summary: It took 20 days to transfer 255 objects from André Breton's studio from Beaubourg in Paris to the Centre Pompidou-Metz near the German border. The collection has been on display since May 8 in an exhibition curated by the artist Maurizio Cattelan.

title: Turkey: After the PKK's dissolution, much remains unresolved for the Kurds
summary: Since 1984, the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) has fought armed conflicts against the Turkish state to gain rights and recognition for Kurds. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's core goal had been ending this conflict.

title: French actor Gérard Depardieu found guilty of sexual assault
summary: A Paris court on Tuesday handed Depardieu an 18-month suspended prison sentence for having sexually assaulted two women on a 2021 film set.

title: Macron to outline plan for rest of his term in a two-hour TV show
summary: The French president will answer questions from high-profile figures, union leaders, influencers and ordinary citizens on prime-time television on Tuesday.

title: King Charles to host Macron for July state visit
summary: The French president and his wife Brigitte will stay at Windsor Castle for the visit from July 8 -10. Emmanuel Macron will also hold talks with the British prime minister during his stay.

title: In Paris and its suburbs, Portuguese cuisine dances between popular dishes and reinvented classics
summary: Many addresses in the Paris region offer traditional and hearty dishes such as octopus rice, red bean cassoulet and baked cod. This Lusitanian heritage is being revisited by a new generation of chefs.

title: Trump focuses on economic diplomacy on his Middle East tour
summary: The American president is set to visit Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the United Arab Emirates, where promises of investments and sensitive issues await him.

title: Kim Kardashian's childhood friend's testimony: 'Take everything. I need to live'
summary: Simone Harouche described to the court how she heard Kim Kardashian beg for her life when she was bound with zip ties and held at gunpoint as the reality star prepares to testify about the 2016 jewel heist.

title: Global warming: The wealthiest 10% are responsible for two thirds of the phenomenon
summary: A study published in 'Nature Climate Change' on May 7 quantifies for the first time how consumption and financial investments contribute to increasing heatwaves and droughts.

title: UnitedHealth Group CEO steps down
summary: America's largest health insurer also announced on Tuesday that it was suspending its full-year financial outlook due to higher-than-expected medical costs.

title: Moratorium between China and the US ends trade war but fails to address underlying issues
summary: Financial markets welcomed the US-China agreement that ended the tariff escalation. But the two powers must still agree on the final level of customs duties, trade rebalancing and microprocessor exports.

title: India-Pakistan: Narendra Modi adds fuel to the fire
summary: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has adopted a rather belligerent tone toward Pakistan. This was a way to reassure ultra-nationalists, who saw the conflict as an opportunity to reclaim the Pakistani-run part of Kashmir.

title: Kim Kardashian tells Paris court 'I thought I was going to die,' at robbery trial
summary: US TV star Kim Kardashian, who was held at gunpoint as masked men robbed her of millions of dollars of jewelry in her Paris hotel in October 2016, also told the court that she forgave one of the main defendants.

title: Zelensky calls on Trump to help him secure a meeting with Putin
summary: After Russian President Vladimir Putin suggested bilateral talks, Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky has pushed for direct talks in Turkey on Thursday, even urging the US to levy sanctions on Russia if Putin refuses to meet.

title: South Africa attempts to restrict firearms use
summary: In a country with one of the highest homicide rates in the world, the government is seeking to limit firearm possession among private security company employees. Dysfunctional on multiple levels, the police services are overwhelmed.

title: The arrest of a Milwaukee judge highlights the clash between Trump and the judiciary
summary: Hannah Dugan, arrested in the courtroom for allegedly obstructing a migrant's arrest, has garnered significant support, including from some Republicans.

title: Cannes opens amidst mounting pressure to condemn Gaza siege
summary: As the 2025 festival begins, over 380 film figures accused Israel of 'genocide' in an open letter and are urging the festival to speak out, while jury president Juliette Binoche hinted at a response.

title: Cannes 2025: Juliette Binoche, the actress who speaks with angels
summary: The French actress serves as the jury president for the 78th Cannes Film Festival, a significant responsibility at a time when cinema, and the broader cultural world, is deeply introspective about its modes of operation.

title: Philippines: Mid-term general elections offer hope to the Duterte family
summary: The results showed the Duterte clan's resilience, despite their many legal woes, and the weakening of the Marcos family, as well as an unexpected surge by a third, progressive 'pink' bloc, heirs to the Aquino dynasty.

title: Trump says he will ease sanctions on Syria and move to restore relations with new leader
summary: The developments announced by Trump on Tuesday were a major boost for the Syrian president, who was previously imprisoned in Iraq for his role in the insurgency following the 2003 US-led invasion of the Arab country.

title: Aesthetic history of the vulva: From private anatomy to political icon
summary: Long perceived as unsettling, the female genital area has been subjected for millennia to more or less invasive acts aimed at shaping it for better control. Today, cosmetic surgery offers to beautify it. This remains a relatively taboo practice, while the vulva is otherwise seen as a feminist symbol.

title: Saudia Arabia throws a decadent welcome for Trump, promising to invest billions in US weapons and AI
summary: On Tuesday, the Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman welcomed Trump with fighter jets and flag-waving cavalry, as the US President lavished praise on the kingdom: 'The transformation that has occurred under the leadership of King Salman and Crown Prince Mohammed has been truly extraordinary.'

title: Beloved former Uruguayan President José Mujica has died at 89
summary: Uruguayan President Yamandú Orsi honored the  'president, activist, guide and leader' while announcing his death on Tuesday. During Mujica's 2010-2015 presidency, he oversaw the radical transformation of the small South American nation into one of the most socially liberal democracies, earning admiration at home and cult status abroad.

title: US debt: The rest of the world's bargaining tool against Donald Trump
summary: One-third of the US debt is held outside of the United States. This is significant enough that the Japanese finance minister has mentioned using this as leverage in trade negotiations.
